alert.note: Alert for Falls (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 26 at 10:16AM CDT until October 28 at 2:38AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Bell, Falls and McLennan counties in Central Texas. * WHEN...Until 1115 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Killeen, Waco, Temple, Copperas Cove, Harker Heights, Belton, Hewitt, Robinson, Bellmead, Woodway, Lacy-Lakeview, Marlin, McGregor, Fort Cavazos, Nolanville, Morgan`s Point Resort, West, Mart, Salado and Beverly Hills.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
